br.edu.ifsp.lp2.shadowstruggles.model
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  br.edu.ifsp.lp2.shadowstruggles.model.Map

public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

A Map object is a three-dimensional Array containing the cards placed on the field. A card is inside an Array of cards, which is inside a tile, which is inside an Array of tiles. Thus, it is possible to have multiple cards on each tile.

Constructor Detail

Map

public Map(java.lang.String name)
Method Detail

cardOnMap

public boolean cardOnMap(Card c,
                         int lane,
                         int player)
Verifies if the card is on the map. Lane is an optional attribute which informs whether a specific lane should be searched or all of them. All of the lanes are searched if lane = -1.

enemyBaseAttacked

public int enemyBaseAttacked()
Verifies if the enemy base is being attacked. The base is being attacked if it's inside the range of an enemy fighter.

playerBaseAttacked

public boolean playerBaseAttacked()
Verifies if the player base is being attacked. The base is being attacked if it's inside the range of an enemy fighter.

getPlayerCards

public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Card> getPlayerCards()
Returns an Array of Card containing all of the cards belonging to the human player on the field.

getEnemyCards

public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Card> getEnemyCards()
Returns an Array of Card containing all of the cards belonging to the machine player on the field.

nextAvailableLane

public int nextAvailableLane(int player)
Returns the next available lane, from top to down. A lane is available if there is at least one free slot in it.

Parameters:
player - Indicates which field to look into: Map.HUMAN_PLAYER or Map.ENEMY_PLAYER.

nextAvailableTile

public int nextAvailableTile(int lane,
                             int player)
Returns the next available tile in the specified lane, from the outside to into the base. A tile is available if it's not occupied by a card.

Parameters:
lane -
player - Indicates which field to look into: Map.HUMAN_PLAYER or Map.ENEMY_PLAYER.

laneWithMoreEnemies

public int laneWithMoreEnemies(int player)
Returns the lane with the greatest number of enemy fighters.

Parameters:
player - Indicates which field to look into: Map.HUMAN_PLAYER or Map.ENEMY_PLAYER.

laneWithLessAllies

public int laneWithLessAllies(int player)
Returns the lane with the least number of allied fighters.

Parameters:
player - Indicates which field to look into: Map.HUMAN_PLAYER or Map.ENEMY_PLAYER.

laneWithMoreEnemiesInvading

public int laneWithMoreEnemiesInvading(int player)

Parameters:
player - Indicates which field to look into: Map.HUMAN_PLAYER or Map.ENEMY_PLAYER.
